data.title: GASTON EYSKENS: 'THERE IS NO SUCH THING AS A UNITED EUROPE'
data.meta_description: GASTON EYSKENS: 'THERE IS NO SUCH THING AS A UNITED EUROPE' - Download as a PDF or view online for free
data.text:
1. Declassified/Released US Department of State EO Systematic Review 30 JUN 2005 Declassified/Released US Department of State EO Systematic Review 30 JUN 2005 Message Text SECRET PAGE 01 BRUSSE 02617 111557 Z 62 ACTION EUR-25 INFO OCT-01 NEA-10 ADP-00 CIAE-00 DODE-00 PM-09 H-02 INR-10 L-03 NSAE-00 NSC-10 PA-03 RSC-01 PRS-01 SS-15 USIA-12 GAC-01 TRSE-00 MBFR-03 SAJ-01 EB-11 EA-11 OMB-01 RSR-01 /131 W --------------------- 036879 R 111343 Z MAY 73 FM AMEMBASSY BRUSSELS TO SECSTATE WASHDC 7512 INFO AMEMBASSY ANKARA AMEMBASSY ATHENS AMEMBASSY BONN AMEMBASSY COPENHAGEN AMEMBASSY LISBON AMEMBASSY LONDON AMEMBASSY LUXEMBOURG AMEMBASSY OSLO AMEMBASSY OTTAWA AMEMBASSY PARIS AMEMBASSY REYKJAVIK AMEMBASSY ROME AMEMBASSY THE HAGUE USMISSION NATO BRUSSELS USMISSION EC BRUSSELS S E C R E T BRUSSELS 2617 E. O. 11652: GDS TAGS: PFOR, BE SUBJECT: FORMER PRIME MINISTER' S COMMENTS ON US- EUROPEAN RELATIONS REF: BRUSSELS 2597 1. GASTON EYSKENS, MINISTER OF STATE AND FORMER PRIME MINISTER, GAVE ME HIS VIEWS IN A CONVERSATION MAY 10 ON DR. KISSINGER' S ADDRESS AT THE ASSOCIATED PRESS LUNCHEON. HE COMMENDED THE TEXT SECRET SECRET PAGE 02 BRUSSE 02617 111557 Z

2. Declassified/Released US Department of State EO Systematic Review 30 JUN 2005 Declassified/Released US Department of State EO Systematic Review 30 JUN 2005 FOR ITS CONCEPTUAL RIGOUR AND WIDE RANGE: QTE EACH WORD HAS BEEN CAREFULLY WEIGHED UNQTE. HE SAID THAT WE NEED NOT BE DISCOURAGED BY THE CARPING COMMENTS OF BELGIUM' S FRENCH LANGUAGE PRESS WHICH TOOK ITS CUE FROM PARIS AND RECEIVED FAVORS-- HONORIFIC AND, PROBABLY, MORE TANGIBLE-- FROM THE GOF. HE SAID THAT THE LINKAGE OF POLITICAL, MILITARY AND ECONOMIC ISSUES IN ATLANTIC RELATIONSHIPS WAS SO OBVIOUS A REALITY AS TO COMPLET THE EUROPEANS TO COME TO GRIPS WITH IT. THE EUROPEANS HAVE TO PICK UP A BIGGER SHARE OF U. S. DEFENSE COSTS IN EUROPE, FOR, QUITE UNDERSTANDABLY, THE U. S. WILL BE RELUCTANT TO RUN A PAYMENTS DEFICIT THAT, IN PART, DERIVES FROM UNREQUITED MILITARY EXPENDITURES IN EUROPE. 2. EYSKENS ASKED ME WHETHER I HAD RECEIVED THE GOB' S REACTION TO DR. KISSINGER' S SPEECH. SEEING NO GOOD REASON TO HEDGE, I SUPPLIED EYSKENS WITH THE GIST OF THE ELSLANDE- DAVIGNON REMARKS ( SEE REFTEL). EYSKENS SAID THAT THERE WAS NO SUCH THING AS A UNITED EUROPE: EUROPE HAD ACHIEVED A CUSTOMS UNION AND LITTLE ELSE. THE PRESIDENT COULD NOT BE EXPECTED TO ENGAGE, IN THE U. S.- EUROPEAN DIALOGUE WITH M. ORTOLI, THE FEEBLE HEAD OF SAID CUSTOMS UNION. HE, EYSHKENS, COULD CONCEIVE OF ONLY ONE POSSIBILITY OF A PRESIDENTIAL ENCOUNTER WITH THE EC, NAMELY A MEETING WITH THE EC CHIEFS OF STATE OR GOVERNMENT ( M. POMPIDOU HELD BOTH JOBS) AT BRUSSELS ( SEE BONN 06738) OR SOME OTHER PLACE. WHETHER OR NOT THE NINE WOULD, AT THIS OCCASION, SPEAK WITH ONE VOICE DEPENDED ON THE EUROPEANS AND NOT ON THE PRESIDENT. HE THOUGHT THEY WOULD NOT DO SO. MR. POMPIDOU HAS BEEN OPPOSED TO THIS KIND OF SUMMIT MEETING IN WHICH FRENCH POLITICAL INFLUENCE AND PRESITGE WOULD BE LIKELY TO BE DILUTED. OF COURSE, A COMMON DECLARATION WOULD HAVE TO BE WORKED OUT BEFORE THE MEETING, LEST IT FAIL ALTO- GETHER TO ADVANCE U. S.- EC RELATIONS. AT PRESENT, THERE IS LITTLE EVIDENCE OF FRENCH WILLINGNESS TO JOIN THE OTHER MEMBERS IN A POSITIVE APPROACH TO THE PROBLEMS OF THE U. S.- EUROPEAN RELATIONS. PERHAPS, THE PRESIDENT WILL BE ABLE IN REYKJAVIK TO BRING M. POMPIDOU AROUND. HAVING ARGUED AT PARIS THE CASE FOR A COMMON POLITICAL POLICY WITH M. POMPIDOU, EYSKENS REMAINED SKEPTICAL. 3. EYSKENS SAID HE BELIEVED THAT IN MATTERS OF FOREIGN POLICY THE PRESENT BELGIAN GOVERNMENT WAS LESS EFFECTIVE THAN ITS PREDECESSOR: THE SOCIALISTS, PRIME MINISTER LEBURTON INCLUDED, WERE INEXPERIENCED AND LITTLE INTERESTED IN FOREIGN POLICY, FOR SECRET SECRET PAGE 03 BRUSSE 02617 111557 Z THE PARTY HAD LEFT FOREIGN POLICY FOR MANY YEARS TO M. SPAAK AND HAD FAILED TO DEVELOP A SUCCESSOR TO THIS TOWERING FIGURE. M. ELSLANDE, AN HONEST AND INTELLIGENT MAN, HAS HAD IN HIS PREVIOUS JOBS LITTLE CONTACT WITH FOREIGN AFFAIRS AND LACKS INTELLECTUAL DEPTH. EYSKENS THOUGHT BELGIUM MIGHT LOSE THE EMINENCE IN FOREIGN AFFAIRS THAT, DESPITE HER LIMITED RESOURCES,

3. Declassified/Released US Department of State EO Systematic Review 30 JUN 2005 Declassified/Released US Department of State EO Systematic Review 30 JUN 2005 SHE HAD ACHIEVED UNDER SPAAK AND HARMEL. 4. EYSKENS CONCLUDED HIS REMARKS WITH A PLEA FOR U. S. UNDER- STANDING OF THE INTERESTS OF THE SMALLER EUROPEAN NATIONS AND THE POLITICALLY STRATEGIC ROLE THEY COULD PLAY, NOT ONLY IN EUROPEAN, BUT ALSO U. S.- EUROPEAN AFFAIRS. TAKING HIS LEAVE, M. EYSKENS CHEERFULLY TOLD ME THAT U. S. DOMESTIC COMMOTIONS WERE INCONSEQUENTIAL AS REGARDS THE ATTITUDES OF EUROPEAN GOVERNMENTS AS WELL AS EUROPEAN PUBLIC OPINION. STRAUSZ- HUPE SECRET NMAFVVZCZ *** Current Handling Restrictions *** n/a *** Current Classification *** SECRET

4.
